Subject: Connection innovation IDs
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=344770077; y=xBYhoTUp7P3wMmu39Mh2sXyoq_qpArzEO7Bf9m_2FO62M0XA4PP6
X-Yahoo-Profile: alienseedpod
From: Colin Green <colin.green1@...>

Hi all,

I'm in the middle of a big rewrite/refactor of sharpneat and I'm about
to make a fairly significant design decision regarding connection
innovation IDs. Basically I'm considering not having innovation IDs on
connections, i.e. the nodes will have innovation IDs but the
connections would be matched on their source and target node IDs.

I wanted to to just poll for opinions on that before I make a final decision.

If I do remove them then it simplifies a lot of code.

Current sharpneat also has innovation 'buffers' whereby we try to
re-use the same connection innovation ID when adding a connection
between two nodes that has already occurred previously elsewhere in
the population, so if we just match on source and target ID then that
will happen anyway without an innovation buffer (there's still another
buffer for 'add node' mutations).

If anyone has strong feelings/arguments on this one way or the other
then I'd be interested in getting feedback on this.

Thanks,

Colin
